content: tin star **disclaimer i know this pattern is very common and there are tons of hats our there like it i just couldn t find anything on ravelry for a bulky knit hat that i want without so much slouch and i didn t want any cabling full ribbing or plain stockinet i decided on a simple seed stitch pattern and eventually ended up with this i cannot take credit for figuring out gauge and cast on stitch amount the majority of bulky hats have same cast on stitches with size 11 needles so this is a free pattern just base on what i did and i hope you enjoy materials 70-90 yards of super bulky yarn i used loops & thread cozy wool in mushroom us 11 - 8 0 mm neeldes us 13 9 0 mm needles pompom maker optional dirrections co 44 stitches with us 11 needles start k2 p2 ribbing until piece measure 2 inches from cast on edge switch to us13 needles r1 k1 p1 * repeat to end on the very last stitch purl into the front and back of the same stitch 45 stitches total r2 p1 k1 * repeat to end r3 k1 p1 * repeat to end repeat r2 and r3 until hat measures 8 inches from co edge this will give the hat a slight slouch you can make this shorter or longer is you wish decreases r 1 p3tog k1 * repeat to end p1 r 2 p1 k1 * repeat to end work r1 and r2 until about 6 stitches remain break yarn and thread through remaining stitches pull tightly and weave in ends make a pompom with the extra/remaining yarn and attach to top of hat
